answers.author: Erin Bryce
answers.text:
I was just at a 3CMA conference where I heard that the City of Slidell, LA received a response from FEMA after Isaac because of Slidell's Facebook page. FEMA told the City of Slidell that they would not have known about Slidell's needs if it wasn't for their Facebook page. Powerful stuff. That anecdote stuck with me.

answers.author: Mike Cohen
answers.text:
Rick, 
We have worked with numerous counties, cities, towns and other government agencies across the US to engage their communities online via strategies that combine social media and an online public comment platform that is civil, legal as well as insightful. Tools such as Fb and Twitter are used to inform and increase awareness, and the online public comment platform is used to have civil, legal and insightful dialogue. For a good example, check-out Salt Lake City: http://www.slcgov.com/opencityhall
Let me know if you want several other examples.
Mike (mike@PeakDemocracy.com)
866-535-8894 x701
